snippet: President Ashraf Ghani lengthened the term of the current Parliament, which was to expire on Sunday, to allow time to negotiate a new date and process for elections.
abstract: Afghan Pres Ashraf Ghani decrees that Parliament's term will be extended as no elections have been scheduled and there has been no agreement in fragile coalition government about how to hold them; international donors have said previously that financing for new elections will be withheld due to disagreement over elections.

byline.contributor: Ahmad Shakib and Azam Ahmed contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: President Ashraf Ghani lengthened the term of the current Parliament, which was to expire on Sunday, to allow time to negotiate a new date and process for elections.

headline.main: Afghan Parliament’s Term Is Extended After Squabbles Delay Elections
headline.print_headline: Afghan Parliament’s Term Is Extended After Political Squabbles Delay Elections
